message: Say I have a Video model (video.rb). Should the controller be video_controller.rb or videos_controller.rb? I think I have seen both.
video_controller.rb is the standard and better name, I think

video_controller.rb is not the standard.  videos_controller.rb is the standard.  Both will work, but videos_controller.rb is the rails way.  If you want to see the standard way of laying things out, try generating a scaffold for video in a new project: rails g scaffold video (in rails 3)
Sorry for my wrong answer, didn't use scaffold for years.
this isn't directly related to your question, but I found where rails implements some of its naming conversions: http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveSupport/Inflector.html
can be kind of useful if you want to know what convention to use, just open up script/console and require "ActiveSupport::Inflector"
The naming convention is: Model in singular and Controller in plural.
